headline: DuPont Names CEO of Electronics Unit to Be Spun Off
summary: DuPont named Jon Kemp to be the CEO of its Electronics segment to be spun off into a separate publicly traded company in November.

raw.headline: DuPont Names CEO of Electronics Unit to Be Spun Off
raw.summary: DuPont named Jon Kemp to be the CEO of its Electronics segment to be spun off into a separate publicly traded company in November.

headline: DuPont insider Jon Kemp to lead electronics unit post spinoff
summary: It is also looking to appoint an external hire as chief financial officer of the unit.  The company had accelerated the separation of its electronics business, which includes semiconductor technologies and interconnect solutions, earlier this year and expects to complete the spinoff by Nov. 1.  DuPont was earlier planning to split into three publicly traded companies, but in January said it no longer intends to separate its water business, but would go ahead with the electronics unit spinoff.

headline: DuPont Announces CEO and Non-Executive Chair for the Planned Independent Electronics Company
summary: DuPont (NYSE:DD) today announced Jon Kemp, President, DuPont Electronics & Industrial will be the Chief Executive Officer and a member of the board of directors for the future independent Electronics public company that will be created following its intended spin-off from DuPont. As a focused independent company, Electronics will be a global leader in materials and technology solutions for the semiconductor and electronics industries.
